bug.short_desc: VLC does not see upnp resources
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
VLC doesn't see upnp resources in LAN/
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start VLC 2. Click Playlist button 3. Select UPnP under Local network
Actual results:
See blank window on the right side
Expected results:
List of available upnp-servers in the LAN.
Additional info: When VLC is started from terminan (e.g. Konsole) there are messages:
[00007fd64c54f808] upnp services discovery: Initializing libupnp on 'default' interface [00007fd64c54f808] upnp services discovery error: Initialization failed: UPNP_E_SOCKET_BIND [00007fd64c54f808] core services discovery error: no suitable services discovery module [00007fd64c54e7c8] upnp services discovery: Initializing libupnp on 'default' interface [00007fd64c54e7c8] upnp services discovery error: Initialization failed: UPNP_E_SOCKET_BIND [00007fd64c54e7c8] core services discovery error: no suitable services discovery module
in the terminal window.

Reply from rpmfusion's bugzilla:
https://bugzilla.rpmfusion.org/show_bug.cgi?id=4381#c5
libupnp is compiled for ipv6 which breaks ipv4 support, please file your report against libupnp instead.

The fix for this is in 1.6.21.
@Ajax, do you have time to push an update? If not, I can push an updated package.
libupnp-1.6.21-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2c29702300
libupnp-1.6.21-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-3bd0b2e2c0
libupnp-1.6.21-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-23535a31f8

libupnp-1.6.21-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-3bd0b2e2c0
